intro: Fagara torva, commonly known as the Caribbean cherry or wild cherry, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Fagara torva thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
